Key Match Events: Devin Booker scored 34 points and the Phoenix Suns never trailed in a 114-106 victory over the Utah Jazz on Saturday.
Booker had 22 points in the first half on 7-of-8 shooting, including 4 of 5 from 3-point range.
Kevin Durant scored 25 points for the Suns, who led by as many as 16 points but struggled to put away the Jazz, who dropped their third in a row, until the fourth quarter.
Grayson Allen had 14 points, nine in the final period.
Allen hit his only 3-pointer of the game early in the fourth quarter to make it a six-point Suns lead and they pulled away after that.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns have won three of four since coach Mike Budenholzer reorganized the Suns' rotation with Bradley Beal coming off the bench.
Ryan Dunn moved into the Suns' lineup at forward.
Post-Match Reflections: Beal had his lowest output since moving into a reserve role, scoring 12 points in 31 minutes. He's still averaging more than 30 minutes in the four games coming off the bench.
